DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study was to evaluate whether an intervention based on the social and emotional competence development improves the healthy lifestyles adoption in young children.
DOC.brief_title: An Exploratory Trial of a Health Education Programme Based on the Social and Emotional Competence in Children
DOC.detailed_description: This study has designed, implemented and evaluated an intervention to promote healthy lifestyles in children addressing the development of the social and emotional competence. This research followed the first three stages of the Medical Research Council framework for complex interventions: the theoretical, modeling phase and the exploratory trial. A randomised control trial with 37 children (5 y 6 years old) was conducted at the exploratory trial. The first unit was implemented in 8 sessions. A multi-method and multi-informant approach was used to assess the preliminary efficacy, acceptability and feasibility of the programme.
DOC.criteria: Children aged 5 and 6 enrolled in a public school in the north of Spain Children with severe cognitive or language special needs
